para.text: Except as otherwise provided in its certificate of trust, a statutory trust:
May not be terminated or revoked except in accordance with this chapter or the terms of the trust’s certificate of trust.
A series of a statutory trust may not be terminated or revoked except in accordance with this chapter or the terms of the governing instrument.

The death, incapacity, dissolution, termination, or bankruptcy of a beneficial owner , trustee, or person designated under § 29-1201.03(e)(8) or (9) does not result in the termination or dissolution of a statutory trust or any series thereof.
A statutory trust or any series thereof shall not terminate because the same person is the sole trustee and sole beneficial owner.

annotations.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 306 of the Uniform Statutory Trust Entity Act.
Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
annotations.annotation: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 rewrote (a); substituted “series of a statutory trust may” for “statutory trust, or any series thereof, shall” in (b); and substituted “trustee, or person designated under § 29-1201.03(e)(8) or (9) does” for “or trustee shall” in (c).
